unnormalised: Breaking News: Local chai stall owner, Mr. Raju, awarded honorary "Dr." title by the 'Gully University' for his pioneering work in perfecting the art of Masala Chai. Sources say his thesis, "The Thermodynamics of Kadak Chai: A Comparative Study of Ginger-to-Cardamom Ratios," was groundbreaking.
normalised: Breaking News: Local chai stall owner, Mister Raju, awarded honorary "Doctor" title by the 'Gully University' for his pioneering work in perfecting the art of Masala Chai. Sources say his thesis, "The Thermodynamics of Kadak Chai: A Comparative Study of Ginger to Cardamom Ratios," was groundbreaking.

unnormalised: The prestigious award was presented yesterday at a grand ceremony attended by auto-rickshaw drivers, local aunties, and a stray dog, all loyal consumers of Mr. Raju’s magical brew. 'Prof.' Sharma from the nearby coaching center commented, "Move over, PhDs! Raju bhai has truly mastered his craft. I might even cite his research in my next lecture on liquid dynamics! He deserves a 'Sir' at the very least."
normalised: The prestigious award was presented yesterday at a grand ceremony attended by auto-rickshaw drivers, local aunties, and a stray dog, all loyal consumers of Mister Raju’s magical brew. 'Professor' Sharma from the nearby coaching center commented, "Move over, P-H-D's! Raju bhai has truly mastered his craft. I might even cite his research in my next lecture on liquid dynamics! He deserves a 'Sir' at the very least."

unnormalised: When questioned on the honor, Dr. Raju, the Chaiwala, said with a humble smile, "Bas bhai, dil se banata hoon! Aur kya? Now, who wants a ₹10 chai?" He then returned to expertly juggling milk and tea, proving that some titles are earned, others are brewed. This just shows you don't need a fancy degree to be the 'best' at what you do!
normalised: When questioned on the honor, Doctor Raju, the Chaiwala, said with a humble smile, "Bas bhai, dil se banata hoon! Aur kya? Now, who wants a rupee ten chai?" He then returned to expertly juggling milk and tea, proving that some titles are earned, others are brewed. This just shows you don't need a fancy degree to be the 'best' at what you do!
